div.l: To bedde went the doughtir right anon̄
To bedde goth Aleyn and also Iohn
It nas no nede to yeue hem dwale
This Milner hath so wisly bibbid ale
That as an hors he fnortith in his slepe
And of his taile behinde he toke no kepe
His wif bare him a burdoıı̄un ful strong
Men might hir here rout a furlong
The wench routith eke ꝑpar cumpany
And Aleyn the clerc hath herd this melody
He poukid Iohn and seid slepistowe
Herdistou euer such a song or now
Lo such a coupling is betuyx hem alle
A wilde fire upon̄ her bodies falle
Who herd euer such a ferly thing
Ye they shul haue the flour of il ending
For in this lang nyght tit me no rest
But yit no force alle shal be for the best
For Iohn seid he als eủer mot I thryue
If that I may the yong wench wil I swyue
Sum element hath lawe y shapen us
For Iohn ther is a law that seith thus
That if a man be in one point agreued
That in anothir he shal be releued
Oure corn̄ is stole sothly it is no nay
And we han hadde an euel fitte to day
And sith I shal haue none amendment
Ageyn̄ my losse I wil haue easment
Be goddis soule it shal none othir be
This Iohn ansuerd Aleyn avise the
This Milner is a ꝑperilous man he seid
And if that he out of his slepe breid
He myght do us bathe a vilany
Aleyn ansuerd I count him not a fly
And up he risith and by the wench he crept
This wench lay upright and fast she slept
Til he so nygh was or that she might aspye
That it had ben to late forto crye
And shortly forto sey they were aton̄
Now play Aleyn for I wil speke of Iohn
This Iohn lith stille a furlong wey or two
And to himselue he makith ruthe and wo
Alas coth he this is a wikid iape
Now may I sey that I is but an Ape
